1.content:

Of course, we're still looking at average. What people are here for is the extraordinary. There are four denizens of this kingdom who are uniquely better endowed than the majority of the town, but there may be more, that is up to you. Let's have a look at the protagonists.

Height: 6 feet 5 inches

Darius is the crown prince of Arcenius, son of Demascus III himself. He is rather tall, with black hair and striking blue eyes set upon a handsome pale-skinned face. He is cold and stern to onlookers. The prince has also inherited an especially large member from his royal lineage, and he is in possession of a large harem of beautiful women, frequently making use of it in order to relieve his otherworldly sex drive. However, his life is routine and mundane. Preparing for the position of King should his father fall and sex are about the only things he does in a day. He desires a change of pace.

Height: 5 feet 7 inches

She serves her king and country diligently, but can't help but be perturbed by the soldiers gawking at her figure all the time. Cass is a woman of beauty, her above-average bust being merely one of the things that would make a man ravish her. Her long brown hair shines like silk, and her figure is perfectly an hourglass shape. Her rank prevents most unwanted advances, but there are some men who would ravage her the moment her guard goes down, with her consent or without it.

Rex Garius
Age: 13
Height: 5 feet 4 inches

Orphaned by the war machine, this young man lives in a brothel after being taken in by its matron. He is a rogue, pickpocketing and conning innocent civilians in order to make additional money for the people he lives with. Living in a tavern brothel business, he often comes back to sex and alcohol, and he has no moral standings against any vice. His sex drive is apparent, and his endowment, which embarrasses men of even Arcenius, belies his young age. Rex is cunning and ruthless to strangers, but gentle and loving to those he cares about. He has brown hair, grown long and messy out of neglect to care for it, and his fierce yellow eyes can intimidate anyone.

Mia Vemetrenalla
Age: 17
Height: 5 feet 6 inches

Her long pitch-black hair and tanned skin betray her Gypsy heritage. She is special even among her spiritual kin, for in her eyes lie the future. She can see events happen before they do, and her skills in divination, tarot, and fortune-telling are thus unparalleled by anyone. Her exotic looks also make her a target, but even demons want her for her mystical power. She has a smaller bust than average, but her exotic looks create a feeling of beauty and serenity about her, but men may be entranced by her endless brown eyes anyway. Mia is a user of magic and can manipulate the minds of people, earning her family their bread and earning her a night with some of the most handsome men in the kingdom. To her, there is nothing that can escape her charm.

But that is enough about the protagonists. Now that you know about them, it is your choice. Will you see the kingdom through their eyes, or perhaps, will you see it through the eyes of another?

Arcenius was a big city, and Rex used that to his advantage. No one knew his name except for his Mother and his Sisters, and he was content to keep it that way. That would make it easier to escape with big winnings and avoid the attention of the hussars. He didn't need a bounty on his head, or people chasing him down.

He was always up for it. He walked a little faster, looking forward to returning as he turned into an alleyway.

He came to a door and knocked three times, smiling at one of his Sisters when she opened the door. It was Josephina. "You're back early." She said to him, looking him over either to see if he was an impostor or if he came back with nothing.

Rex entered the back door and placed a large purse of money on the table, its contents jingling loudly as the bag deformed. He then produced several smaller purses and placed them down as well. "I ran into a noble." He said, explaining the copious amount of money. "And a bunch of people who decided that they would have their money hanging on their belts. They deserve to have their money stolen if they're gonna do that."

"Oh, that's lucky." She smiled, looking over the stolen items.

"Hey Josephina," he addressed her, "could you tell Mother that I'm back? I'm gonna grab an drink."

She nodded, letting him do his thing while he poured himself some whiskey from a bottle and downed some. The heat of the alcohol ironically soothed his parched throat, giving a clear tell as to his rather abundant indulgences in vice.

He looked to where Josephina went. Out of all of his Sisters, he really liked Josephina. She had a really large chest, for one, but her eyes were always gentle and kind. Her long black hair was always done up in a ponytail when she served clients, but when she was off duty she wore it down, allowing it to beautifully cascade down her back. He must have been a long hair sort of person too. Perhaps he'd ask her to have sex. However, despite the money on the table, he had been out for a relatively short time today. He sipped at his whiskey, pondering how he would spend the rest of his day.

133.content:
Rex looked outside the window, viewing the alley with boredom. Having finished his day early, he had no choice but to sit around as nothing would be happening for a while. He took a drink from his whiskey and, frowning at his cup, picked it up and downed it all on one go.

He heard footsteps enter the room. Looking past his mug he noticed Mother Ruthie, the owner of the brothel he worked/lived at and his parental figure, for lack of a better term. "Ah, there you are, Rex dear. Before you go off to do something else, I was wondering..."

Option 1: "I was wondering if you could go back out and do some more work. We're actually short on funds this month, so I figured it might be better to ask for more."

Option 2: I was wondering if you could help out at the front desk. Only for an hour, of course -- Cherise is taking her break."
133.title: Something else...

choices: The bazaar on Main Street, one of the better places to go for the most marks.
A side alley, to prey on people when they're alone and least expect it.
1331.content:
"I was wondering if you could go back out and do some more work. We're actually short on funds this month, so I figured it might be better to ask for more." Ruthie admitted, looking somewhat ashamed. "I know that I disagreed to you doing this in the first place but... we need the money."

Rex's features softened as he took in Ruthie's downtrodden expression. Obviously, it took effort for her to come out and say this, so he figured he could do her this favor. She had taken care of him for years now, there was nothing he wouldn't do for his mother.

"Sure, I'll do it." He nodded, drinking the last of his whiskey. "I have no problem."

"Thanks a lot." Ruthie grinned. "You know how much this means to me."

"That I do." He said. "I'll be back at sundown then."

He left through the back door, same way he came in, and pondered. Where should he go next for his misdeeds?
1331.title: Aaaaand back out again!

choices: The patron is a hussar in full uniform, shining armor and everything!

1332.content:
"I was wondering if you could help out at the front desk. Only for an hour, of course -- Cherise is taking her break." Ruthie said, her calming smile ever present on her lips. She wasn't malicious by any means - Rex knew that their business was running rather slowly and they were currently short on funds, thus instead of hiring more people she simply had Rex help carry some of the load. When he wasn't out pickpocketing during the day he mostly helped out during the night, tending the front desk, cleaning rooms, et cetera, and occasionally he was to please a female patron if she asked for him specifically, although that didn't happen particularly often.

"Sure, I suppose. I wasn't planning on doing anything else today." He shrugged, polishing off the last of his whiskey before placing his mug on the counter with the dirty dishes - thankfully it wasn't his turn to do them today.

"Thanks dear." Ruthie smiled as he walked out. Rex wandered down the hall before emerging from the door behind the front desk. He noticed Cherise there, helping another customer. He stood back against the wall and waited for her to finish before speaking to her.

"Mother says you can take your break, I'll cover you." He said. Cherise looked at him and smiled, making Rex's heart melt. Out of all of his sisters, the eighteen year old girl was definitely the one people called the cutest. Her bright blonde locks curled in front of her, resting on her ample D-cup chest. She was otherwise very petite, standing a tad shorter than Rex and much thinner, she still was curvy enough to whet men's desires.

"Aw, thanks Rex. I'll get some rest now." She said, leaving through the back door. Rex smiled once more and took her place at the counter, propping his elbow on the wood and waiting for a customer. As soon as his elbow touched down with the oak, the bell over the door rang, and Rex looked up to see the patron.
